content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Science Pack Production Facility (around position 8.5, 13.5)
Consists of:
- Assembling machine-1 at position (8.5, 13.5)
- Input chest at position (5.5, 13.5)
- Output chest at position (11.5, 13.5) containing automation science packs
- Two burner inserters:
  - One at (6.5, 13.5) moving items from input chest to assembling machine
  - One at (10.5, 13.5) moving items from assembling machine to output chest

### Iron/Copper Production Area (around position -25.0, -59.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-28.0, -61.0)
- Input chest at (-27.5, -59.5)
- Stone furnace at (-25.0, -59.0)
- Output chest at (-22.5, -58.5) containing iron and copper plates
- Burner inserters connecting these components at (-26.5, -59.5) and (-23.5, -58.5)

### Secondary Mining Setup (around position -18.0, -53.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-18.0, -53.0)
- Input chest at (-17.5, -51.5)
- Stone furnace at (-15.0, -51.0)
- Output chest at (-12.5, -50.5) containing iron plates
- Burner inserters connecting components at (-16.5, -51.5) and (-13.5, -50.5)

### Power Generation System (around position -4.5, 12.5)
Consists of:
- Steam engine at (-4.5, 12.5)
- Boiler at (-4.5, 16.0)
- Offshore pump at (-3.5, 27.5)
- Connected by pipe groups carrying water and steam
- Powers an electrical network (id=13683) connecting multiple components

### Coal Mining Setup (around position 41.0, -82.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (41.0, -82.0)
- Storage chest at (41.5, -80.5) containing coal
- Burner inserter at (41.5, -79.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Errors when extracting non-existent items
- Always verify item existence in chest before attempting extraction
- Check chest inventory contents before attempting to extract items
- Consider implementing a retry mechanism with proper inventory checks

### Resource shortage errors
- Ensure all required ingredients are available before starting production
- Monitor assembling machine input resources to prevent production stalls
- Keep track of ingredient requirements and maintain adequate supply

### Power/Fuel related errors
- Keep mining drills fueled to maintain continuous operation
- Monitor fuel levels in burner inserters and mining drills
- Implement regular fuel checking and refueling routines

### Production flow issues
- Ensure proper connection between production steps
- Monitor and maintain continuous flow of materials between machines
- Keep track of input/output chest contents to prevent bottlenecks
